qas.question: How many asphalt upgraders operate in Alberta?
What synthetic product is produced by upgraders?
Besides crude oil, what does the Suncor Energy plant produce?
Where is a sixth upgrader being built in Alberta?
How much of the production of the Redwater plant will into diesel fuel?
How many bitumen upgraders produce synthetic crude oil in Edmonton?
When is the seventh upgrader scheduled to be under construction?

plausible_answers.text: crude bitumen directly to diesel fuel

qas.question: The sixth upgrader will upgrade two thirds of what?
The remainder of the output will be sold to Suncor Energy as what?
Where is the Shell Oil upgrader located?

context: In Alberta, <a0_0><b5_0>five<b5_0/><a0_0/> bitumen upgraders produce synthetic <a1_0>crude oil<a1_0/> and a variety of other products: The Suncor Energy upgrader <b9_0>near Fort McMurray<b9_0/>, Alberta produces synthetic crude oil plus <a2_0>diesel fuel<a2_0/>; the Syncrude Canada, Canadian Natural Resources, and Nexen upgraders near Fort McMurray produce synthetic crude oil; and the Shell Scotford Upgrader near Edmonton produces synthetic crude oil plus an intermediate feedstock for the nearby Shell Oil Refinery. A sixth upgrader, under construction in <b6_0>2015<b6_0/> near <a3_0>Redwater, Alberta<a3_0/>, will upgrade <a4_0>half<a4_0/> of its <b7_0>crude bitumen directly to diesel fuel<b7_0/>, with the remainder of the output being sold as <b8_0>feedstock<b8_0/> to nearby oil refineries and petrochemical plants.
